methods.get:
Returns the table in a form that the user can run queries on it. This may be as simple as returning a
 reference, but for amorphous tables, this means we need to do the work to instantiate it.

:return: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) the table
methods.getDefinition:
Get the definition, without instantiating the table.

:return: (io.deephaven.db.tables.TableDefinition) the definition of the table
methods.getSize:
What size should the uninitialized table return.

:return: (long) the size
methods.getWithWhere:
Get the table in a form that the user can run queries on it. All of the filters that can be run efficiently
 should be run before instantiating the full table should be run. Other filters are returned in the
 remainingFilters field.

:param selectFilters: (io.deephaven.db.v2.select.SelectFilter...) - filters to maybe apply before returning the table
:return: (io.deephaven.db.v2.DeferredViewTable.TableReference.TableAndRemainingFilters) the instantiated table and a set of filters that were not applied.
methods.selectDistinct:
If possible to execute a selectDistinct without instantiating the full table, then do so. Otherwise return
 null.

:param columns: (io.deephaven.db.v2.select.SelectColumn[]) - the columns to selectDistinct
:return: (io.deephaven.db.tables.Table) null if the operation can not be performed on an uninstantiated table, otherwise a new table with the
         distinct values from strColumns.

text: The table reference hides the table underlying table from us.
